content: little cottage author aga tutak woolside pl yarn drops karisma no 72 about 5 - 7 meters drops karisma no 60 about 5 meters a little bit of black or graphite thread for window materials double pointed needles size 2 5 mm durning needle stitch marker washable stuffing twine little carabiner decorative pendant optionally gauge information 7 sts in width and 9 row in hight with stocking stitch alternate a knit row with a purl row = 2 5 cm / 2 5 cm 0 98 in / 0 98 in size 7 cm 2 75 in high and 5 5 cm 2 16 in wide abbreviations st - stitch sts - stitches k - knit m1 - make 1 stitch lift the right leg of the next stitch place it of the left needle then knit it as you would any other stitch k2tog - knit two stitches together dpn - double pointed needle round - round the little cottage is knitted in rounds with k all sts start from the bottom edge cast on 24 sts with colour 72 and put them onto 3 dpns as follows 1st dpn - 6 sts 2nd dpn - 12 sts 3rd dpn - 6 sts place marker at the beginning of round and work 1 - 8 k all sts cut yarn sew together the bottom edges on the left side of work change colour of yarn and continue back on the right side of work 9 k5 m1 k2 m1 k10 m1 k2 m1 k5 = 28 sts 10 k all sts 11 k6 m1 k2 m1 k12 m1 k2 m1 k6 = 32 sts 12 k all sts and every alternate round 13 k5 k2tog k2 k2tog k10 k2tog k2 k2tog k5 = 28 sts 15 k4 k2tog k2 k2tog k8 k2tog k2 k2tog k4 = 24 sts 17 k3 k2tog k2 k2tog k6 k2tog k2 k2tog k3 = 20 sts 19 k2 k2tog k2 k2tog k4 k2tog k2 k2tog k2 = 16 sts 21 k1 k2tog k2 k2tog k2 k2tog k2 k2tog k1 = 12 sts 23 k1 k2tog k2tog k2 k2tog k2tog k1 = 8 sts cut yarn thread end into a durning needle and slip through remaining live sts stuff the cottage fasten_off and secure weave in loose ends using colour of your choice embroider the window attach the carabiner and decorative pendant if you want your little cottage is ready ♥ © all rights reserved
